official_title: A Phase 3 Randomized Trial Of Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy, Excision And Observation Versus Chemoradiotherapy For Early Rectal Cancer
brief_title: Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy, Excision And Observation vs Chemoradiotherapy For Rectal Cancer
cancer_type_display: A study comparing chemotherapy with or without radiation before surgery for patients with early-stage rectal cancer.
prior_treatments_excluded: Previous pelvic radiation for any reason, including brachytherapy alone.
Patients who have had primary lesion excised prior to enrollment.

locations.facility: UCI Health - Chao Family Comprehensive Cancer Center and Ambulatory Care

key_inclusion_summary: Histologically confirmed invasive, well-moderately differentiated rectal adenocarcinoma.
Mid to low-lying tumour eligible for transanal excision.
Medically fit to undergo radical TME surgery.
key_exclusion_summary: High-risk pathologic factors on diagnostic biopsy (poorly differentiated, mucinous or signet ring histology).
Visible pelvic sidewall nodes on MRI.
Previous pelvic radiation for any reason.
Patients who have had primary lesion excised prior to enrollment.
